pain_points_original.title: Mandatory PROTECTED-Level Security & Sovereignty
pain_points_original.description: AGS requires a solution certified to the IRAP PROTECTED level and compliant with data sovereignty, storing all data within Australia. This is a non-negotiable requirement to safeguard sensitive government legal information, mitigate national security risks, and meet strict regulatory obligations.

pain_points_original.title: Boosting Productivity Across Diverse Legal Tasks
pain_points_original.description: With 570 lawyers, AGS needs to improve efficiency across a wide array of complex legal workflows, from document drafting and discovery to contract analysis and summarisation. The goal is to supplement existing tools and automate repetitive tasks, freeing up lawyers for high-value strategic work.

pain_points_original.title: Crucial Integration with Core Legal Systems
pain_points_original.description: The AI solution must integrate seamlessly with AGS's core software: iManage Cloud (DMS), Elite 3E (practice management), and Microsoft Office. A lack of integration would create data silos and inefficient workflows, defeating the primary goal of improving productivity for their 800 staff.

pain_points_original.title: Need for Explainable and Responsible AI
pain_points_original.description: AGS requires any AI solution to be ethical, transparent, and explainable. As a government legal provider, the ability to understand and justify how an AI reaches its conclusions is critical for legal accountability, professional responsibility, and maintaining trust in its processes.

merge_decisions.merged: Crucial Integration with Core Legal Systems
Need for Explainable and Responsible AI
